claim: If characters from animated television series were added to the dataset, the proportion of blue-eyed superheroes would increase.
extra_info: percentage = MULTIPLY(DIVIDE(SUM(superhero_name WHERE color = 'Blue'), COUNT(superhero_name)), 100.0); blue eyes refers to color = 'Blue' and color.id =  eye_colour_id = 7;
reasoning: The claim is about a hypothetical scenario — what would happen if characters from animated television series were added to the dataset. The database contains no information about the source media type of characters, nor about characters that are not already in the dataset. There is no way to verify or refute whether adding animated TV characters would increase the proportion of blue-eyed superheroes.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE alignment
(
    id        INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    alignment TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE attribute
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    attribute_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE colour
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    colour TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE gender
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    gender TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE publisher
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    publisher_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE race
(
    id   INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    race TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);
CREATE TABLE hero_attribute
(
    hero_id         INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_id    INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_value INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (attribute_id) references attribute(id),
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id)
);
CREATE TABLE superpower
(
    id         INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    power_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE hero_power
(
    hero_id  INTEGER default NULL,
    power_id INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id),
    foreign key (power_id) references superpower(id)
);

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/superhero.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) as total, SUM(CASE WHEN eye_colour_id = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as blue_eyed, ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN eye_colour_id = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*), 2) as pct FROM superhero;"
input.description: Get total heroes and blue-eyed proportion

content.thinking:
The claim says "If characters from animated television series were added to the dataset, the proportion of blue-eyed superheroes would increase."

This is a hypothetical claim about what would happen if new data were added. The database doesn't contain information about characters from animated television series that aren't already in it, nor does it have any way to predict what eye colors those characters would have.

The database contains current superhero data. There's no information about animated television series characters that could be added. This is a speculative/hypothetical claim that cannot be verified from the database alone.

This should be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO since the database doesn't contain information about characters from animated television series that could potentially be added, nor their eye colors.

content.text: The claim states that adding characters from animated television series would increase the proportion of blue-eyed superheroes. Let me check if the database has any information about animated television series or source media types.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/superhero.sqlite" "SELECT publisher_name, COUNT(*) as cnt, SUM(CASE WHEN s.eye_colour_id = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as blue_eyed, ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN s.eye_colour_id = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*), 2) as pct FROM superhero s LEFT JOIN publisher p ON s.publisher_id = p.id GROUP BY publisher_name ORDER BY cnt DESC;"

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/superhero.sqlite" "SELECT superhero_name, full_name FROM superhero WHERE publisher_id = 6;"

content.text:
The database contains only one character from Hanna-Barbera (an animated television studio) and no specific column or table tracking the media type (e.g., "animated television series") of characters. The claim is about a hypothetical scenario — what would happen **if** characters from animated television series were added. The database has no information about:

1. Which characters come from animated television series (no media-type column)
2. What characters from animated TV series are *not yet* in the dataset
3. What eye colors those hypothetical characters would have

The database simply cannot tell us whether adding animated TV characters would increase or decrease the proportion of blue-eyed superheroes. This is a speculative, counterfactual claim that goes beyond what the data can verify.
